Name: Increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.

History.AgendaNote: Proposed Int. No. 219-A - Amended and Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Amended and Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity

Text:
LOCAL LAWS
OF 
THE CITY OF NEW YORK
FOR THE YEAR 2002

No. 16


Introduced by Council Member Weprin (by request of the Mayor)

A LOCAL LAW

To amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the enhanced 911 emergency telephone system surcharge.


Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
    
    Section 1. Subdivisions (a) and (c) of section 11-2323 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 94 for the year 1991, are amended to read as follows:
    (a) In accordance with the provisions of article six of the county law, as amended, there is hereby established a surcharge of [thirty-five cents] one dollar per telephone access line per month on the customers of every telephone service supplier within the city of New York.
    (c) All telephone service suppliers which provide local access service within the 911 service area in the city of New York shall begin to add the monthly surcharge of one dollar per telephone access line per month as provided in subdivision (a) of this section to all service bills no later than the forty-fifth day after the effective date of [this] the local law that increased such surcharge to one dollar per telephone access line per month.
    � 2. This local law shall take effect immediately.
   � 3. Notwithstanding the provisions of section two of this local law, if New York Assembly Bill No. 11817 has not become a law prior to the time that this local law is enacted, then this local law shall take effect immediately upon the enactment into law of such bill.



THE CITY OF NEW YORK, OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, s.s.:
    I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of a local law of the city of New York, passed by the Council on June 21, 2002, and approved by the Mayor on July 10, 2002.
    	VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk Of The Council.





CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO MUNICIPAL HOME RULE LAW �27
    Pursuant to the provisions of Municipal Home Rule Law �27, I hereby certify that the enclosed Local Law (Local Law 16 of 2002, Council Int. No. 219-A) contains the correct text and:
    Received the following vote at the meeting of the New York City Council on June 21, 2002:   47 for, 3 against, 0 not voting.
    Was signed by the Mayor on July 10, 2002.
    Was returned to the City Clerk on July 16, 2002.
    
    	JEFFREY D. FRIEDLANDER, Acting Corporation Counsel
	2
